name: deimosrising
text: Did they get hella broads? it is not clear

name: giessel
text: A comment left by giessel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Deusoma, hcaz, Anniqu3, equinn2006, farqussus, NDCaesar, waldo913, aHatOfPig, mystkmanat, hellofditties)

name: stevegt500
text: He's so pumped

name: zzzleepy
text: yeeeeaaaaaaahhh!!!!!!!!!

name: mustakrakesh
text: This strip reminds me of Cameron and Farris driving the corvette into Chicago.

name: terriblerobot
text: You mean the 1961 Ferrari 250 GT California. Much better than a mere corvette.

name: terriblerobot
text: yes i am aware it was a fake

name: courtland
text: Quite clear in fact as to its "mere corvette" status.  I am so high right now, everything is in perfect clarity.

name: choosebro
text: Wait, Ray isn't in panel 8. My mind is slightly blown. Either that or I lack the necessary counting skills.

name: primal_in_the_mane
text: A comment left by primal_in_the_mane was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, NeoNaoNeo, godfatherofsouls, psykeres)

name: howard
text: Yeah I prefer thinking that it's a alternate stuffed toy universe or something.

name: primal_in_the_mane
text: exactly. and when there is cross-over it should be non-chalant, like baby chat Onstad had with Ray and Beef.

name: deimosrising
text: A comment left by deimosrising was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, NeoNaoNeo, Deusoma, erincandy)

name: straw
text: You are all missing the point that when a cat has his mind set to it no human will ever catch it

name: zefiel
text: God damn it this is so true. It is IMPOSSIBLE to catch a cat.

name: molesticide
text:
my cat can actually take me out, i'm not joking.

he hides under the bookcase, behind this little rug we have draped over it. when you walk past, the cat rushes out, jumps up and attacks you directly behind the knee, completely unbalancing you and sending you right down to the ground.

then he runs, jumps to the top of a chair, misses, falls, and hides in embarrassment.

I HAVE JUST TOLD A STORY ABOUT MY CAT

i am cool

name: massialot
text: Do not forget that Achewood is essentially some dude telling stories about his cats on a (semi) daily basis. Although, I guess the mandate to do so becomes a lot more prominent when huge vintage American cars and 34 AIBOs show up at your house randomly.

name: donnatron
text:
My cat LETS me catch him doing things, just so he can look cute and innocent afterward. He gets some sadistic satisfaction out of steering me away from seeming stern.

Once the alliteration began I had to keep going with it...

name: belgand
text: Reward chubby for the alliteration. Keep it up!

name: kledermans
text: Personally I disagree.  I think it's amusing when we are reminded that they're cats in a human world.  I'm the kind of reader who needs devices like the Underground or the even more bizarre [url="http://achewood.com/index.php?date=08302005]hulls"[/url] to keep the human/cat boundaries from bothering me.

name: kledermans
text: Okay I suck at the url tags, but I don't feel like fucking around with it until it's fixed.

name: cailetshadow
text: I totally agree with this. I think Onstad's concept of "hulls" were one of the most brilliantly funny aspects of early Achewood. I have been a little disappointed that they seem to have dropped out of the world.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Everybody ought to go look for America at some point in their lives.

name: rotating-dog
text:
Beef, I said as we boarded a Galaxie in Achewood,
Michigan seems like a dream to me now

name: belgand
text:
I think I know what America is like and frankly I'm very scared of it. I do not want to be anywhere near that place.

It is eating at a chain restaurant while thinking racist thoughts about the staff and then going home to watch reality shows and have bland, vanilla missionary sex and hope get off on the idea of being so kinky as to leave the lights on so you can each see your flabby bodies.

There is no single America, but if we sift through it all we'll end up with something profoundly frightening.

name: boredom_man
text: The best (and by "best" I mean absolutely horrible) thing about San Francisco is how the people who now live there have abandoned all of the values of the people who popularized it, while often proclaiming themselves to be the sole protector of these values. But contemporary Caucasian SF culture was, more than any other concept, founded on Kerouac's love for travel, his desire to embrace all humans, and his desire to find beauty in all Americans. The original hippies were running from something, so their xenophobia is excusable to a point, but at this time all SF has to justify its elitism is the apparent belief that slipping someone a roofie is an alternative sexual position.

name: boredom_man
text: PLEASE tell me you have a better response than that. There must be some reason you can live with your provincialism?

name: belgand
text:
*Ignore User*

click

name: boredom_man
text: buh-bye, hick. Take the only tree that's left and stuff it up the hole in your culture, 'kay?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I think this is karma, boredom_man, for ignoring woodenteeth because of his beliefs re: smoking. Something tells me you probably don't care.

(The only reason I even though of this was because I came upon that strip the other day.)

name: xud
text: On the radio "Red Barchetta" by Rush is playing

name: erinye
text:
I didn't think it was possible to improve this strip until your comment.

Though I'm almost tempted to suggest "Circumstances" instead.

name: red-barchetta
text: Here is a chubby for you good sir!

name: honesttom
text: It's strips like this that make the Road Trip arc my pers'nal favourite.

name: ferdinand
text: there has never been anything more intense than beef getting psyched up like that.  after reading this strip, i walk around in a state of fear and awe towards cats for days.

name: boyd
text: beef is so angry that he has not yet found america in his life.

name: i_love_kate
text: Last four panels make this a five. As well as Ray's pose in the last one. Are his middle fingers raised? We may never know.

name: cailetshadow
text: Aim that car at a rainbow, Roast Beef Kazenzakis

name: cameasiam
text: No one knows who America is Beef, no one.

name: professorhazard
text: I can catch a cat.

name: heccibiggs
text: I'll believe it when I see it.

name: professorhazard
text:
I'll let my wife demonstrate our proven method for me:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=esaFtmrnbQQ

name: heccibiggs
text: ...Impressive.

name: riste
text: The laundry basket method has never failed me.

name: greenkoolayd
text: so is this a natural behavior, or a learned behavior?

name: atmus
text: Professor Hazzard? More like Lie Bot!

name: professorhazard
text: See above.

name: atmus
text: A cat jumping into an open laundry basket doesn't count as you catching it.  Next time, at least pick it up to prove the cat doesn't just jump out while laughing at your foolishness.

name: professorhazard
text: Go to bed, Atmus.

name: atmus
text: Why?  So you can take a video of it and claim you apprehended me?

name: professorhazard
text: Yes.

name: atmus
text: Ooooooohhhhhh Shhhhiiiiittttt

name: bilingualmonkey
text:
"You could see a rainbow turnin' out badly!"

Yes.

name: leggotheego
text: Gotta love geeky indignation.

name: tttt2
text: there are only 44 states they could drive through

name: killingthejay
text: I guess they haven't heard of hulls yet.

name: thegoodwillgirl
text: Immediate 5'd for Ray's hands in the last panel.

name: mrfedora
text: Man, when I look at panels 7 through 9, I can just faintly hear Jukebox Hero playing, as Beef gets just hella psyched up

name: mr_lostman28
text: I hear the opening to "Radar Lover"

name: squares
text: so - you don't have to hold a grudge because i called you out for quoting alanis morisette. seriously. no hard feelings. but let me return the favor.

name: aargh
text: Nah, its the intro to Eternal Life

name: zapatos
text: I hell of love me some road trips, I would so buy those cats a tank of gas.

name: mikeronomicon
text: Beef's eyebrows when his stones drop are awesome. That is one feline you don't wanna fuck with.

name: dancemanleo
text: no way in a thousand hells can a rainbow go badly

name: dj_douche
text: The Ass In Your Pants/road trip storyline segue is where Achewood starts in earnest ..
